thread.title: Glow in the Dark Easter Eggs Using Flameless Tea Light Candles
thread.title_full: Glow in the Dark Easter Eggs Using Flameless Tea Light Candles

author: Lina (Hip's Modern Martha)
title: Glow in the Dark Easter Eggs Using Flameless Tea Light Candles
text:
Need a fun Easter activity this year to do with the kids? 
Host a Glow in the Dark Easter Egg Hunt in the evening using plastic eggs and LED tea lights. They are easy to put together and look super cool with the flickering light.
You could alternatively use glow sticks, but the tea lights can be re-used for next year or for other projects!

Glow in the Dark Easter Eggs Supplies: Plastic Easter Eggs Flameless Tea Light Candles Directions: Place tea lights inside eggs (along with any other coins or small goodies) and secure shut. Hide them for a festive glow in the dark nighttime Easter Egg Hunt! I love how the tea lights look really bright inside the eggs! I can’t wait to do this with my kids at Easter! Enjoy! 30 Things to Hide in Easter Eggs Besides Candy Written by Lina for Hip2Save. Lina is a proud mom of 2 kids who loves photography, all holidays, cooking, thrift store makeovers, bargain shopping, and DIY makeovers. Her goal is to create a beautiful life and stylish home on a dime! To see all of Lina’s DIY/Crafts created just for Hip2Save, click here .
